newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul bourse halts trade in Daewon Paper.
newsitem.headline: Seoul bourse halts trade in Daewon Paper.

text.p: The Korea Stock Exchange suspended trading in Daewon Paper Mill Co's shares for one day on Tuesday because the stock will be placed under the exchange's supervision list, an exchange statement said.
"The stock will be put under the supervision list on Wednesday as the company failed to submit its annual report for calendar 1996," said an exchange official.
He said the deadline was by the end of business on Monday.
A Daewon Paper official said the company's operation has been suspended for a long time due to a strike.
Trading in Daewon shares will resume on Wednesday.
The stock last traded at 5,700 won on Monday.
